Review_Text: I liked it a lot and watched it twice. I enjoyed the film making skills and cinematography, the location and beautiful scenery. Also the quiet determination of the family with the occasional bleakness of the landscape.
You go along with the Prince of Muck and you're served with your own island. The island in you, the island with its inhabitants and nature. This film gives you a journey into life.

This was such a moving film detailing the ups and downs of life in a small island community. The resilience and spirit of the local people is portrayed so powerfully. This is such a personal and beautifully shot piece. The long shots of the stunning Scottish landscapes mixed with the intricacies of rural life are mesmerising. For those who love wild Scotland it's a must see and even for those who are unfamiliar it's a great story of family relationships and life. I've watched it many times since it's release and I can't recommend it enough. It is a touching tribute to a man that loved his island.
